total_impedance_ori_txt.item: R4 and R3 connected in series so Rc=R4+R3=2.0000 Ohm
R2 and Rc connected in parallel so Rb=R2*Rc/(R2+Rc)=1.0000 Ohm
Rb and R1 connected in series so Ra=Rb+R1=5.0000 Ohm
The total impedance is Ra = 5.0000 Ohm

total_impedance_txt.item: R4 and R3 connected in series so Rc=R4+R3=2.0000 Ohm
R2 and Rc connected in parallel so Rb=R2*Rc/(R2+Rc)=1.0000 Ohm
Rb and R1 connected in series so Ra=Rb+R1=5.0000 Ohm
The total impedance is Ra = 5.0000 Ohm

solution.item: At first we calculate the total resistance between the generator nodes
R4 and R3 connected in series so Rc=R4+R3=2.0000 Ohm
R2 and Rc connected in parallel so Rb=R2*Rc/(R2+Rc)=1.0000 Ohm
Rb and R1 connected in series so Ra=Rb+R1=5.0000 Ohm
The total impedance is Ra = 5.0000 Ohm
Now we calculate the current on VS1
We know that the voltage between VS1 nodes is 6.0000 V.
We calculated previously the impedance between VS1 nodes: this is 6.0000 Ohm.
So the current on VS1 is 1.2000 A.
